snippet: The mass abduction, on April 14, 2014, was just one of hundreds of acts of brutality that Boko Haram has rained down on West Africa in recent years.
abstract: Majority of Nigerian schoolgirls kidnapped by Boko Haram in 2014 remain missing; abductees' family and friends are increasingly critical of government, which insists its fruitless two-year search effort will continue.

byline.original: By CHRIS STEIN and DIONNE SEARCEY
byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The mass abduction, on April 14, 2014, was just one of hundreds of acts of brutality that Boko Haram has rained down on West Africa in recent years.

headline.main: 2 Years After Boko Haram Kidnapping, the Search Goes On for Nigerian Girls
headline.print_headline: 2 Years Later, the Grim Search Continues for Kidnapped Nigerian Girls

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
